alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong line of showers will impact portions of Talbot, Queen Anne`s, Caroline and Kent Counties through 630 PM EST... At 559 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers and perhaps some embedded thunder along a line extending from near Langford to near Rock Hall to Romancoke to Talbot to near Tilghman Island to Taylors Island. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Chestertown, Denton, Centreville, Federalsburg, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Rock Hall, Trappe, St. Michaels, Church Hill, Preston, Oxford, Millington, Sudlersville, Betterton, and Goldsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
